channel.title: Wheeling on El Pudu: Living and working from our Airstream
channel.description: Recent content in Wheeling on El Pudu: Living and working from our Airstream

item.title: Beartooth Pass Shoshone National Forest
item.description: Beartooth Getaway This campsite was a high altitude stunner. We were up around 8600 ft or so above sea level in an alpine tundra. The main reason we came all the way up here was that the temperatures below were extremely hot. We’re talking above 95F as we were coming up the Beartooth Highway. Finally things cooled off a bit up here, though not by much. We still were having 85F daytime temps even at this altitude.

item.title: Pole Mountain Medicine Bow NF
item.description: Vedauwoo Overlook We found this spot on Campendium here: https://www.campendium.com/pole-mountain-area Coming out Monday morning, we saw that quite a few of the spots were occupied. I hopped on the bike and went for a little ride to scout camps and was able to find one within easy reach of the Pudu. The camp is at the top of the hill on the side of a meadow with a cool rock outcropping and lots of nice sites around.

item.title: Mt Shavano Blm
item.description: Mt. Shavano BLM Overview This was a very pretty BLM area outside of Salida. It’s super close to both Hecla and Stonebridge and only about 10-15 minutes to Walmart. This was our first boondocking adventure and so we wanted to be close to town as well as close to rafting. Good We stayed at the end of a cul-de-sac overlooking the mountains towards Gunnison. We had a ton of privacy and beautiful views and we were able to burn before Memorial Day Weekend; after which, there was a fire ban.
